Because I have more than one disability. Please fix this problem and respond to this message on your app review please!

All third party Messenger apps have been stopping to work recently. I was hoping I could find a well made wrapper for the desktop version of Messenger as a solution. With SlimSocial - I have found it. Unfortunately, there are no message notifications. Here's what I suggest: enable users to set a time interval that the app would use to check for new messages. For example: if the interval is set to 5 min, the app will load the top chat and check if there are any changes (new messages) every 5 min.

After 15 minutes of using it, I quickly decide to make a review of how light and fast this app works compare to Facebook lite and browser. The installation is extremely small footprint and very customizable. Here is some improvement and request for the app and here is my list: 1. Dark theme needs to be improved as some text could not be read especially Grey color text 2. Request to have option hide "people you may know" and "suggested groups".

SlimSocial is great if you want stripped-down access to FB and Messenger without all the bells and whistles. It is limited in what FB features are accessible; HOWEVER I find that a huge bonus, as the point for me is to spend less time and attention on FB. For someone who wants to limit FB use and has privacy and security concerns, SlimSocial is a great alternative to the official apps.

I'm really satisfied with this app. I'll mention only 3 bugs that I'd like to be fixed. First one is occurring using Marketplace: going back after seeing an item makes you come back to the news feed instead of the marketplace home page. Thus meaning starting again with the same search for seeing other results. Second one are the lack of calls and the display of messenger app in general, which don't allow you to do many things other than typing short messages. Long messages are in fact quite difficult to write since the really short space available to read your message while you're typing. Last but not the least: tagging other people using the @tag is really painful and it's not always working. It isn't possible to tag a person only using his name and it's not possible to tag pages. That's all. Keep up the good work!

I'm trying out all the lightweight Facebook apps and this one I'll compare 
with "swipe for Facebook". As the name indicates one can simply swipe 
across screen to see the different feeds. In this one, "slim Social", one 
must use two hands to see different the feeds, unless it's a very small 
phone. It riddles me that such a logic feature are left out. Also, the 
"swipe for Facebook" has the option to choose material look making all 
posts like "cards" which is a VERY nice looking feature.

Does everything I'd hoped for except send Messenger notifications, and my 
phone is now noticeably cooler now that it's not running any Facebook apps!

So far, so good. I dislike the bloat of the original Facebook app so this 
helps however, only two things are not doing so well. 1. It's a little 
uncomfortable clicking on shared posts to see comments. Potentially 
something I have to get used to. 2. The icon that shows as if it's 
refreshing at the top will not go away. Fix these and 5 stars will come. 
Thanks for this project!

This is a great little app and fantastic for speeding up my low memory device, now no longer clogged up with the dreaded official app. I love the idea of a dark theme for easing strain on the eyes. HOWEVER, black background with nearly white writing is still quite harsh. ALSO, really wish scheduled posting worked. Nearly 5*
